summary: Looking for more blogs to follow / mutuals!
body:
Looking for more blogs to follow / mutuals!

If you regularly post any of the following, reblog this post and I’ll check out your blog.

  • Marvel
  • Spider-Man / Peter Parker
  • Daredevil

Or, if you’re already following me but I don’t follow you and you post this type of content, comment and I’ll look at your blog too :)

title: Drunk Tony, during a party :
body:
Tony looking at Dr Strange : Let’s say an Asgardian and a humain man fell into the river. Wich one will you save ?
Stephen : I’ll probably kill this guy.
Tony looking at Loki : A sorcerer and a humain fell into the river. wich on will you save ?
Loki : I think I’ll end up killing him first, Doctor.
Tony, back to Strange : Then what if the two of us fall into the river ?
Stephen : I hope the river is deep.

title: Running From My Shadow
body:
Loki has escaped the Asgard prison, again.

Soft Praise To a Hard Lie

It had become one of his favorite hobbies, if not the only one. Sneaking out of prison every other day was something that filled Loki with joy, whether it was to steal something or play pranks on Thor…

Read more…

body:
Avengers: EndGame ‘Prediction/ Theory’

What if Scott was stuck in a parallel universe and the one in the Endgame trailer was a past Scott before everything happened, that’s why he seems so normal. That could mean that’s how they get everyone back; through Scott’s Quantum theory and his chips if he can make enough. Maybe thats what they have to do in order to revive all of humanity, but they have to wipe all of humanity’s memory of Thanos and the events taken place in Infinity War for the protection of the Avengers.


Anyway I had fun with this. Be free to add onto this. Also, Merry Christmas

summary: Avengers Spotlight #21 (1989) Hawkeye somehow ends up in the desert with Orb, the less-attractive Harvey Dent. They're being...
caption:
Avengers Spotlight #21 (1989)

Hawkeye somehow ends up in the desert with Orb, the less-attractive Harvey Dent. They’re being stalked by Plantman for ruining his bio-dome which surely had Pauly Shore in it made completely of celery. Hawkeye has to fill his quiver full of water which should effectively ruin his arrows but kayfabe I guess.

Later, Starfox goes to a flea market planet to buy a woman named after a furnace from a bunch of Skeksis dressed like Rip Torn in BEASTMASTER.

Email the podcast at worstcollectionever@gmail.com

Continue the conversation with Shawn and Jen on Twitter @angryheroshawn and @JenStansfield

blog.name: ao3feed-clintxnat
blog.title: love is for children, i owe him a debt.
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of all fic posted on the Archive Of Our Own under the Clint Barton/Natasha Romanov pairing tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed using an IFTTT recipe, but this was made easy thanks to astolat (astolat.tumblr.com). If you would like to set up a similar blog, see the instructions tab :) To check announcements regarding these blogs, go to the tumblr tag #ao3feed announcement. (moderated by enjolbutt.tumblr.com) I hope this blog helps when you are in dire need of feels or a laugh, so enjoy! :)

title: crucibles
body:

title: A Sweet Surprise
body:
A/N: Okay so this story is for the wonderful @devilbat and their Holiday Bonanza Writing Challenge. I am super excited to write this and I hope that you guys like it. 

Tony Stark x Reader

Summary: “I can’t believe you did all this, for me,” Tony surprises you with his extravagant decorating.

Warnings: Fluffff

Growing up was not the best experience for you. It’s not that you had a bad childhood, it’s just that you never really got to spend the holidays with your family. You felt like you always missed out on the fun holiday traditions that every other kid got to have. Your mother was always gone on a business trip for work, and your father could care less about giving. I mean, your mother did all of the work and paid all of the bills. So with her being gone, you really didn’t celebrate Christmas. Even as an adult you were always busy. Since you didn’t grow up getting to celebrate Christmas, you just never felt the need to do anything special. 

“So wait, you’re telling me that you have never put up a Christmas tree or lights?” Tony asked with a shocked expression. “You have to be lying, right?”

“No I’m not lying,” you say nonchalantly. “My mother was never home and my father could care less, so we really never got to do anything special,” you say as you dropped your head sadly.

Truth be told, you had always wanted to be able to enjoy the beauty of Christmas in your home. You had always imagined drinking hot chocolate and staring at a Christmas tree. You always looked in awe at all of the houses that got all decked out with lights during December. But you never did, and you had basically given it up.

“Well I have to go,” you say as you walk by Tony and kiss him on the cheek. “Christmas shopping has to get done sometime.”

“Bye, be careful,” Tony said as you walked out the door. 

Now, Tony Stark was never one to get too festive for Christmas. Sure he would put up a tree and maybe some lights, but he didn’t go overboard with the decorations. But this year, being the first time that you two spent Christmas together, he was determined to get the whole tower in lights. He started by pulling out all of the supplies that had just built up over the years. He knew that the crowds would be crazy, so he knew that you wouldn’t be home for a while, which gave him enough time to get started. Tony was one to let his pride get to him, so he convinced himself to not ask anyone for help. So he worked without stopping until he was done. 

6 Hours Later

You were exhausted. You should’ve known better than to procrastinate, but nonetheless you did, and you were certainly regretting it. After you had dragged all of your bags to the main entrance of the tower for someone else to get later, you walked in to what looked like a dream. 

All you could do was stare in awe at what was before your eyes. Lights were everywhere, multiple trees were decorated, but one big tree stood in the middle of the room, catching your attention and never letting it go. 

“Do you like it?” Tony asked from behind you. “I hope you do because now my back hurts,” Tony says in his infamous Tony Stark tone. 

“You, you did this?” you ask Tony in disbelief. You couldn’t believe that someone would go to this length to make you happy. 

“You better believe it,” Tony smirked as he wrapped his arm around you, handing you a cup of hot chocolate as he led you to the couch in front of the huge tree. 

You two sat on the couch and you cuddled into his side, him reacting by putting an arm around you. You were so caught up in the decorations that you completely forgot about the hot chocolate that was going cold. 

“Hey babe, your hot chocolate that I slaved over is going to get cold,” Tony says as he looks at you. “Is there something wrong?”

“No, no there’s nothing wrong at all,” you say with a small smile. “I just, I can’t believe you did all this, for me,” you say as you turn away from his gaze. 

“Hey,” he says softly as he turns your head back towards him, “you are worth every single minute of decorating.” “If I could, I would decorate the whole world for you,” he says with a smile. 

You just smiled to yourself, wondering how on Earth you got so lucky. 

“Well thank you, I really do appreciate this,” you say to Tony. 

“Anything for you,” he says as he leans in for a kiss. 

As you two kiss, you can’t help but smile because your dream for Christmas had finally came true. It came true because of Tony Stark.

Truth be told, you had always wanted to be able to enjoy the beauty of Christmas in your home. You had always imagined drinking hot chocolate and staring at a Christmas tree. You always looked in awe at all of the houses that got all decked out with lights during December. But you never did, and you had basically given it up.

“Well I have to go,” you say as you walk by Tony and kiss him on the cheek. “Christmas shopping has to get done sometime.”

“Bye, be careful,” Tony said as you walked out the door. 

Now, Tony Stark was never one to get too festive for Christmas. Sure he would put up a tree and maybe some lights, but he didn’t go overboard with the decorations. But this year, being the first time that you two spent Christmas together, he was determined to get the whole tower in lights. He started by pulling out all of the supplies that had just built up over the years. He knew that the crowds would be crazy, so he knew that you wouldn’t be home for a while, which gave him enough time to get started. Tony was one to let his pride get to him, so he convinced himself to not ask anyone for help. So he worked without stopping until he was done. 

6 Hours Later

You were exhausted. You should’ve known better than to procrastinate, but nonetheless you did, and you were certainly regretting it. After you had dragged all of your bags to the main entrance of the tower for someone else to get later, you walked in to what looked like a dream. 

All you could do was stare in awe at what was before your eyes. Lights were everywhere, multiple trees were decorated, but one big tree stood in the middle of the room, catching your attention and never letting it go. 

“Do you like it?” Tony asked from behind you. “I hope you do because now my back hurts,” Tony says in his infamous Tony Stark tone. 

“You, you did this?” you ask Tony in disbelief. You couldn’t believe that someone would go to this length to make you happy. 

“You better believe it,” Tony smirked as he wrapped his arm around you, handing you a cup of hot chocolate as he led you to the couch in front of the huge tree. 

You two sat on the couch and you cuddled into his side, him reacting by putting an arm around you. You were so caught up in the decorations that you completely forgot about the hot chocolate that was going cold. 

“Hey babe, your hot chocolate that I slaved over is going to get cold,” Tony says as he looks at you. “Is there something wrong?”

“No, no there’s nothing wrong at all,” you say with a small smile. “I just, I can’t believe you did all this, for me,” you say as you turn away from his gaze. 

“Hey,” he says softly as he turns your head back towards him, “you are worth every single minute of decorating.” “If I could, I would decorate the whole world for you,” he says with a smile. 

You just smiled to yourself, wondering how on Earth you got so lucky. 

“Well thank you, I really do appreciate this,” you say to Tony. 

“Anything for you,” he says as he leans in for a kiss. 

As you two kiss, you can’t help but smile because your dream for Christmas had finally came true. It came true because of Tony Stark.
trail.content:
A/N: Okay so this story is for the wonderful @devilbat and their Holiday Bonanza Writing Challenge. I am super excited to write this and I hope that you guys like it. 

Tony Stark x Reader

Summary: “I can’t believe you did all this, for me,” Tony surprises you with his extravagant decorating.

Warnings: Fluffff

Growing up was not the best experience for you. It’s not that you had a bad childhood, it’s just that you never really got to spend the holidays with your family. You felt like you always missed out on the fun holiday traditions that every other kid got to have. Your mother was always gone on a business trip for work, and your father could care less about giving. I mean, your mother did all of the work and paid all of the bills. So with her being gone, you really didn’t celebrate Christmas. Even as an adult you were always busy. Since you didn’t grow up getting to celebrate Christmas, you just never felt the need to do anything special. 

“So wait, you’re telling me that you have never put up a Christmas tree or lights?” Tony asked with a shocked expression. “You have to be lying, right?”

“No I’m not lying,” you say nonchalantly. “My mother was never home and my father could care less, so we really never got to do anything special,” you say as you dropped your head sadly.

Truth be told, you had always wanted to be able to enjoy the beauty of Christmas in your home. You had always imagined drinking hot chocolate and staring at a Christmas tree. You always looked in awe at all of the houses that got all decked out with lights during December. But you never did, and you had basically given it up.

“Well I have to go,” you say as you walk by Tony and kiss him on the cheek. “Christmas shopping has to get done sometime.”

“Bye, be careful,” Tony said as you walked out the door. 

Now, Tony Stark was never one to get too festive for Christmas. Sure he would put up a tree and maybe some lights, but he didn’t go overboard with the decorations. But this year, being the first time that you two spent Christmas together, he was determined to get the whole tower in lights. He started by pulling out all of the supplies that had just built up over the years. He knew that the crowds would be crazy, so he knew that you wouldn’t be home for a while, which gave him enough time to get started. Tony was one to let his pride get to him, so he convinced himself to not ask anyone for help. So he worked without stopping until he was done. 

6 Hours Later

You were exhausted. You should’ve known better than to procrastinate, but nonetheless you did, and you were certainly regretting it. After you had dragged all of your bags to the main entrance of the tower for someone else to get later, you walked in to what looked like a dream. 

All you could do was stare in awe at what was before your eyes. Lights were everywhere, multiple trees were decorated, but one big tree stood in the middle of the room, catching your attention and never letting it go. 

“Do you like it?” Tony asked from behind you. “I hope you do because now my back hurts,” Tony says in his infamous Tony Stark tone. 

“You, you did this?” you ask Tony in disbelief. You couldn’t believe that someone would go to this length to make you happy. 

“You better believe it,” Tony smirked as he wrapped his arm around you, handing you a cup of hot chocolate as he led you to the couch in front of the huge tree. 

You two sat on the couch and you cuddled into his side, him reacting by putting an arm around you. You were so caught up in the decorations that you completely forgot about the hot chocolate that was going cold. 

“Hey babe, your hot chocolate that I slaved over is going to get cold,” Tony says as he looks at you. “Is there something wrong?”

“No, no there’s nothing wrong at all,” you say with a small smile. “I just, I can’t believe you did all this, for me,” you say as you turn away from his gaze. 

“Hey,” he says softly as he turns your head back towards him, “you are worth every single minute of decorating.” “If I could, I would decorate the whole world for you,” he says with a smile. 

You just smiled to yourself, wondering how on Earth you got so lucky. 

“Well thank you, I really do appreciate this,” you say to Tony. 

“Anything for you,” he says as he leans in for a kiss. 

As you two kiss, you can’t help but smile because your dream for Christmas had finally came true. It came true because of Tony Stark.
